messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: oops!
messages.msgSnippet: Not sure where you are, but coming toward the end of April is Ska Weekend here in Ktown, and it s going to be awesome. Mind if I ask what Ktown is?
messages.messageBody:
Not sure where you are, but coming toward the end of April is Ska
Weekend here in Ktown, and it's going to be awesome.>>>>>>>>>>

Mind if I ask what Ktown is? Knoxville? We are in Mississippi 5 miles from the Memphis TN border.

Whew I gotta have a talk with this little about the lip piercing thing. She's 6 lol. What the heck is she going to be wanting to do at 16?

She had picture day at school and came home mad. She shot up her little punk rock sign ( anarchy sign) and the photographer told her to put her hands down.

Sigh ok Ill shut up now. She decided to take a break for the past 5 days and went back to school today. I miss her already!

Nicole

messages.subject: Re: oops!
messages.msgSnippet: ... bout 5 hours from me :)   I dont call myself punk though I do enjoy punk/ska music and my 6 year old has plans to dye her hair pink the last day of school
messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, Nicole Willoughby
<cncnawilloughby@...> wrote:
>
> Hey! The Creepy Crawl........assuming you live near there you are
bout 5 hours from me :) I dont call myself punk though I do enjoy
punk/ska music and my 6 year old has plans to dye her hair pink the
last day of school and get her lip pierced.
>
> Nicole

A couple members of the intended board live in St. Louis. I'm several
hours away in East TN. I was perusing Myspace when I noticed the
band's schedule and remembering some of the punk parents discussing
the club.
Not sure where you are, but coming toward the end of April is Ska
Weekend here in Ktown, and it's going to be awesome. It's a whole day
ska festival, several stages. We've taken the boys three years in a
row now and are sooooo excited for this next one.
Actually, the first that we attended was three years ago, so the
youngest may not have quite been here all the way at the time

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] oops!
messages.msgSnippet: It s OK by me, Sam. I m delighted to know that such a thing as united punk parents exists, though my own punk days are 20 years in the past. Su
messages.messageBody:
It's OK by me, Sam. I'm delighted to know that such a thing as united
punk parents exists, though my own punk days are 20 years in the past.

Su

On Feb 6, 2006, at 9:01 PM, sam wrote:

> That last post was in the wrong group! Sorry, but this is definitely
> not united punk parents!

Nicole
